body.p: The Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA) is an XML-based architecture oriented to authoring, producing, and delivering technical information. It divides content into small, self-contained topics that you can reuse in different deliverables. The extensibility of DITA permits organizations to define specific information structures and still use standard tools to work with them. provides schema driven (DTD, RNG, XSD) templates for DITA documents.
